options.text: Please provide your preferred configuration options for the Azure VM that will host your Azure Local environment. The VM size should be large enough to accommodate your Azure Local infrastructure (DC, WAC, AzL machines), which you'll configure on the next tab. Use the Tool Tips for guidance with each parameter.

elements.name: virtualMachineName
elements.label: Virtual Machine Name
elements.toolTip: Provide a name for your Azure VM. This VM name should be less than 15 characters and should not contain ASCII or special characters

validations.message: Virtual machine name cannot contain non ASCII or special characters, must contain at least one alphabet, and must be between 1 and 15 characters.

elements.name: virtualMachineSize
elements.label: Azure Local Host VM Size
elements.toolTip: Select your preferred VM size. These sizes have been selected based on support for nested virtualization, capacity to run a nested Azure Local environment, along with flexible options for Premium Storage and temp storage

elements.name: dataDiskType
elements.label: Data Disk Type
elements.toolTip: The Storage type of the VM data disk. If your VM contains an 's' in the VM size, you can select Premium_LRS storage for increased performance, but at a higher cost.

elements.name: dataDiskSize
elements.label: Data Disk Size
elements.toolTip: The size of the individual data disks in GiB. 8 of these will be provisioned and 64GiB is the recommended default.

options.text: Provide your preferred credentials for the Azure Local Host VM. These credentials will be used to log in to the VM and to the nested lab machines.

elements.name: adminUsername
elements.label: Admin Username
elements.toolTip: The administrator username for the VM and for login to the nested lab machines

constraints.validationMessage: Only alphanumeric characters are allowed, and the value must be 1-30 characters long.

toolTip.password: The administrator password for the VM and for login to the nested lab machines. The password must be alphanumeric, contain at least 12 characters, and have at least 1 letter and 1 number.

options.text: Provide your preferred RDP port to connect to the Azure Local Host VM. The default port is 3389.

elements.name: customRdpPort
elements.label: Remote Desktop Port
elements.toolTip: If you wish to use a different port to RDP into the VM (between 0 and 65535), change it here, otherwise, leave the default.

options.text: The Azure Local Host VM runs Windows Server 2025 Datacenter.
You can save up to 49% of the running cost of this VM, with a Windows Server license you already own using Azure Hybrid Benefit.

elements.name: azureHybridBenefitFirstCheck
elements.label: Would you like to use an existing Windows Server license for the Azure Local Deployment Workshop?
elements.toolTip: If you own Windows licenses with active Software Assurance (SA) or have an active Windows Server subscription, use Azure Hybrid Benefit to save compute cost.

elements.name: azureHybridBenefitSecondCheck
elements.label: I confirm eligibility for the Azure Hybrid Benefit.

options.text: Select your Azure Local architecture from the available options, along with your preferred per-machine memory and domain name.

link.label: Learn more about the network patterns/architectures for Azure Local

elements.name: azureLocalArchitecture
elements.label: Azure Local Architecture
elements.toolTip: Select your preferred Azure Local architecture. The number of nested Azure Local machines and their network configuration will be determined by this selection.

elements.name: azureLocalMachineMemory
elements.label: Azure Local Machine Memory
elements.toolTip: Select the memory per Azure Local machine. If you choose more memory than will fit on your host system, the per-machine memory will be reduced automatically.

elements.name: domainName
elements.label: Domain Name
elements.toolTip: The preferred domain name for the environment. This must be a valid domain name with a maximum of one subdomain, and will be used to create the Active Directory domain.

constraints.validationMessage: Please enter a valid domain name, in the format azl.lab, or corp.azl.lab. A maximum of a single subdomain is supported.

options.text: Choose whether you wish to install Windows Admin Center in your Azure Local environment. This can be used to perform additional management tasks against your Azure Local machines and instance.

elements.name: installWAC
elements.label: Install Windows Admin Center
elements.toolTip: Select Yes to install Windows Admin Center in your Azure Local environment.

options.text: Choose to opt-in to telemetry collection to better understand impact of the Azure Local Workshop/MSLab scripts.

Telemetry includes number of VMs deployed, where MSLab is being used etc. Data sent from scripts is hosted in the Azure Application Insights service and it is absolutely transparent what information is being collected, since all code is visible in PowerShell Scripts on the MSLab Github repository.
Configure your preferred auto-shutdown settings for the Azure Local Host VM. This will help you save costs by shutting down the VM when not in use.
